result.execSummary:
The defendant James L. Kirk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>2500-10,000 g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)4.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>1000-2500g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)3.
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  ANY PRESCRIPTION TO BE APPROVED BY AGENT.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May not have contact with anyone who uses or traffics controlled substances, known felons, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
**The Court approves contact with Robin S, Nicholas K, and Michelle K.  Although the Deft will be allowed contact with those individuals, the Deft will NOT be allowed to reside in the same residence as those individuals.  Contact with the adult children is permitted as long as the agent and children consent to the contact.  The children shall provide consent to the agent prior to the contact commencing.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent w/ Ct 1 but Consecutive to Ct 3.

Contact with the adult children is permitted as long as the agent and children consent to the contact.  The children shall provide consent to the agent prior to the contact commencing.

Changing the conditions as to no contact orders.

09:31 AM ADA Lehman appeared in person for the State. DE appeared by video means in Custody. Probation Agent S.Cole appeared by video means. Social Worker Cummins appeared by video means.
DAR Reporter: Leah Slaght. Clerk: S.Shaw.
MINUTES: 
Matter here on Letter received from DE requesting amendment to the JOC, to allow contact with certain family members. Social Worker Cummins has no objection to the request. Agent S. Cole states that the DE will not be allowed to reside with his significant other when he is released, but has no objection to amending the JOC to allow contact with the family members. The State has no objection to the DE's request to allow contact with his significant other, but objects to the DE having contact with the adult children. The Court approves contact with R.S. , N.K and M.K. Although the DE will be allowed contact with those individuals, the DE will not be allowed to reside in the same residence as those individuals. Contact with the adult children is permitted as long as the agent and children consent to the contact. The Children shall provide consent to the Agent prior to the contact commencing. The JOC shall be amended to reflect this information.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Bihler.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On ct 3 the court imposes a total sentence of 15 years WSP, 10 years initial confinement w/credit for 562 days served, 5 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for SAP, deft is not eligible for CIP; on cts 1, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7 & 8 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 10 years w/conditions, concurrent to each other and consecutive to ct 3; on ct 9 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions, concurrent with cts 1, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7 & 8 and consecutive to ct 3; deft to pay $2,200 DNA surcharges.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Bihler.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Day 2.  State files amended information.  Atty Bihler acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Testimony taken from:  Megan W.  State rests.  Atty Bihler moves to dismiss.  Court denies motion to dismiss for reasons set forth on the record.  Defense rests.  Jury instructions given.  Closing arguments.  Jurors deliberate at 12:28pm.  Verdicts reached at 1:33pm.  Jury finds deft guilty of cts 1 thru 9.  Jurors excused at 2:02pm.  Court enters judgment on cts 1 thru 9.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 7/16/15 at 3:30pm.  Court lifts no contact provision of bond concerning contact w/Michelle R K, Nicholas D K, Robin S.  Bond revoked.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Bihler.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court reports that an issue has been raised concerning a juror.  Juror S.R. is sworn in & testified.  Court excuses juror S.R. at 8:41am.  Jurors sworn and preliminary instructions given.  Opening statements given.  Testimony taken from:  KPD Detective Ryan Pfeffer, Alexia B., KPD Detective Josh Zeller, KPD Officer Ryan Sieker, KPD Officer Austin Brechue, KPD Sgt Aaron Dillhoff.  With the agreement of the parties, Detective Traxler transported exhibit 10 to and from the crime lab to have weighed to settle discrepancy.  Trial to continue 5/28/15 at 9am.  Jurors excused at 4:38pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Johnson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Johnson motion to withdraw as counsel; states the deft filed an adversary action against her that she was not aware of at the time she withdrew her motion to withdraw.  Court grants Atty Johnson's motion to withdraw.  Court addresses recent filings of deft and will not officially respond to motions as they have been previously ruled on.  ADA Graveley argues against the court appointing new counsel or the appointment of a new public defender based on deft being the cause of past attorneys being fired or leaving the case.  Deft states he wants exculpatory evidence turned over to him.  Atty Johnson states she turned over a copy of the report to the deft.  Court requests that the public defender appoint new attorney for deft; all motions to be filed through counsel.  STC 2/12/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
